intro: Ctenodon foliolosus, commonly known as the leafy ctenodon, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are divided into several lobes resembling fingers. Its flowers are typically pink or purple and are arranged in clusters. Ctenodon foliolosus is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and showy blooms.
